paper_abstract: Let C be an [n., k, d] binary linear code with rate R = k/n and dual C-perpendicular to. In this correspondence, it is shown that C can be represented by a 4-cycle-free Tanner graph only if: [GRAPHICS] where p = n - k and d(perpendicular to) is the minimum distance of C-perpendicular to. By applying this result, it is shown that 4-cycle-free Tanner graphs do not exist for many classical binary linear block codes.
